solution.text: Eukaryotic cells have a well-defined nucleus and organelles. These include cell membrane, cell wall (absent in animal cells), nucleus, endomembrane system, mitochondria, endoplasmic reticulum, golgi apparatus, lysosomes, plastids, ribosomes, cytoskeleton, microtubules etc. Golgi apparatus is named after his discoverer Camillo Golgi. These consist of many sacs or cisternae arranged parallelly to each other. The main function of Golgi is to pack the proteins which are formed in the endoplasmic reticulum. Golgi apparatus consists of two sides: the concave or cis or forming face and the convex or trans or maturing face. The forming face will collect the unpacked materials from ER and the pack it and it is released from the convex side. The Golgi is able to receive it from ER because it is derived from it.
